metadata.synopsis: A dialogue with Nubaldin, overseer in House of Hope, that ordered Gortash around during his time of being enslaved

26.speaker: Nubaldin
26.text: Stay out of my way, don't touch anything, and keep quiet.
26.context: NodeContext: harrassed, annoyed to be interrupted

22.speaker: Nubaldin
22.text: I've had enough pests bothering me today, I don't need another.

52.speaker: Player
52.context: NodeContext: explaining the function of the room he's guarding, quite self-important

59.speaker: Nubaldin
59.text: The Chamber of Egress - way station of the hells, providing access to Raphael's clientele wherever they might make their home.
59.context: NodeContext: explaining the function of the room he's guarding, quite self-important

78.speaker: Nubaldin
78.text: I am its keeper, Nubaldin. Very much not at your service.

55.speaker: Player
55.context: NodeContext: Annoyed to hear mention of Hope 'the greatest pest of all'. He hates her, but more like you might hate a mosquito that is buzzing around than a nemesis

5.speaker: Nubaldin
5.text: The greatest pest of all! I've always thought Hope to be a dirty, empty little word. She suits it well.
5.context: NodeContext: Annoyed to hear mention of Hope 'the greatest pest of all'. He hates her, but more like you might hate a mosquito that is buzzing around than a nemesis

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I'm trying to track her down, but she keeps flickering away.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Any idea where I can find her?

2.speaker: Nubaldin
2.text: She pops in and out of existence all over the House, but whatever you've seen is just a trick of the light.

72.speaker: Nubaldin
72.text: Her corporeal form is down in the dark, bound by unbreakable chains in Raphael's dungeon.

77.speaker: Nubaldin
77.text: It used to be my prison - Nubaldin's very own pit of pain - I was its keeper. But that was a very long time ago.
77.context: NodeContext: annoyed, reminiscing on a post he used to hold that has been taken from him

70.speaker: Nubaldin
70.text: A nasty little optimist, who doesn't have the good sense to lose her mind completely like the rest of us.

63.speaker: Nubaldin
63.text: She has a rather loathsome habit of popping into existence all over the house to shout words of encouragement to the other denizens.

44.speaker: Nubaldin
44.text: But her appearances are just a trick of the light.

21.speaker: Player
21.context: NodeContext: emphasis on 'undesirable' to contrast with desirable in previous line

48.speaker: Nubaldin
48.text: I used to work in the prison, ensuring no desirable people left the House of Hope.
48.context: NodeContext: emphasis on 'undesirable' to contrast with desirable in previous line

13.speaker: Nubaldin
13.text: Now, I guard the portals to ensure that no undesirable people enter.
13.context: NodeContext: emphasis on 'undesirable' to contrast with desirable in previous line

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Why don't you work in the prison anymore?
54.context: NodeContext: a little bitter, reminiscing on a mistake

6.speaker: Nubaldin
6.text: I made a mistake. Raphael doesn't tolerate mistakes.
6.context: NodeContext: a little bitter, reminiscing on a mistake

8.speaker: Nubaldin
8.text: We had one houseguest by the name of Gortash, a mischievous little blot of a boy, and he slipped through my fingers.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I'd like to visit the prison. Where is it?
0.context: NodeContext: suspicious, slight emphasis on 'you' - he's wondering why a stranger would want to see the prison

30.speaker: Nubaldin
30.text: What interest do you have in the prison?
30.context: NodeContext: suspicious, slight emphasis on 'you' - he's wondering why a stranger would want to see the prison

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I'd like to spend some time tormenting the inmates.

20.speaker: Nubaldin
20.text: We all must have our hobbies, I suppose.

39.speaker: Nubaldin
39.text: We all must have our hobbies, I suppose.

18.speaker: Nubaldin
18.text: All right, all right. Turn left when you exit this chamber, and you will find a hatch that leads beneath the House. That's where we keep the naughtiest souls.
18.context: NodeContext: short-tempered on 'alright, alright', then giving clear directions

40.speaker: Nubaldin
40.text: Do watch out for the guards though. They're not as reasonable as you and I.
40.context: NodeContext: a warning, but delivered with a smile - it amuses him to tell us of the danger awaiting us

53.text: You're already tormenting me with all of these questions. I've had quite enough of answering them, thank you very much.

42.speaker: Nubaldin
42.text: You're already tormenting me with all of these questions. I've had quite enough of answering them, thank you very much.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Just tell me where it is before I rip out whatever's left of your soul.

45.speaker: Nubaldin
45.text: Turn left when you exit this chamber, and clamber down the hatch that leads beneath the House.

58.speaker: Nubaldin
58.text: With any luck, the guards will swallow you whole, you repugnant little scrap.

11.speaker: Player
11.context: NodeContext: inner thoughts - pondering, giving clear directions

75.speaker: Nubaldin
75.text: Strange that they need directions. There's only one way into the prison - down the hatch at the end of the corridor on the left.
75.context: NodeContext: inner thoughts - pondering, giving clear directions

10.speaker: Nubaldin
10.text: Strange that they need directions. There's only one way into the prison - down the hatch at the end of the corridor on the left.
10.context: NodeContext: inner thoughts - pondering, giving clear directions

41.text: You're not allowed to do that! Nobody but Raphael can see my thoughts!

57.speaker: Nubaldin
57.text: You're not allowed to do that! Nobody but Raphael can see my thoughts!

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I'd like to see the prison that held the former Lord Gortash. Where is it?

43.speaker: Nubaldin
43.text: I'd like to escort the killer of Gortash there myself,  but I cannot leave my post.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Gortash was here? Lord Enver Gortash?

65.speaker: Nubaldin
65.text: Lord? Is that what he calls himself these days? The snivelling little shit.

29.speaker: Nubaldin
29.text: He was the son of a cobbler or somesuch meagre tradesman, sold to Raphael by his loving parents to pay off a petty debt.
29.context: NodeContext: enjoying telling this horrible story

73.speaker: Nubaldin
73.text: Lord indeed. I used to bruise my knuckles on his whimpering little face. I'd like to have snapped his neck!
73.context: NodeContext: first two words he's reflecting on how preposterous the concept of Gortash being a 'lord' is. Then building anger

38.speaker: Player
38.text: You'll be pleased to hear I killed him.

1.speaker: Nubaldin
1.text: You fabulous murderer. Oh, I wish I could have seen him grovel and beg and bleed. Maybe his soul will come to us one day.

33.speaker: Nubaldin
33.text: Such a splendid deed deserves a splendid reward, and there's no better reward in the hells than the pleasures and pains of the flesh.

60.speaker: Nubaldin
60.text: There are few sensations that can't be indulged in Raphael's boudoir. I'm not permitted to enter, but I know a secret way inside.
60.context: NodeContext: a little but secretive, but not whispering

12.speaker: Nubaldin
12.text: Make your way ot the balcony next door, and you can find your way inside. Just make sure not to fall. It's a long way down.
12.context: NodeContext: final warning delivered with a hint of amusement

56.speaker: Player
56.text: I'd like to snap his neck myself.

61.speaker: Nubaldin
61.text: Then why not get to the snapping of necks instead of the flapping of lips. I tire of you.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: You missed your chance. Let's talk about something else.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: How did Gortash end up here in the House of Hope?

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Gortash is dead, by my hand.

49.speaker: Nubaldin
49.text: Away with you. The portals are closed.
